snippet: Instances of wanton violence have been swiftly judged to be the work of terrorists, even when there is little evidence of direct ties to terrorist groups....
abstract: Rise of Islamic State and concept of self-radicalization causes confusion over whether attackers such as Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who drove truck through crowd in Nice, France, are formally aligned with militant group or merely deranged.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Instances of wanton violence have been swiftly judged to be the work of terrorists, even when there is little evidence of direct ties to terrorist groups.

headline.main: In the Age of ISIS, Who’s a Terrorist, and Who’s Simply Deranged?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
